abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings show satisfactory
            outcomes, likely sustainability, with modest institutional
            development impacts. Among the lessons learned, the adequacy
            of the project's lending instrument, highlights the
            high degree of flexibility allowed in adjusting existing
            projects, to a post-conflict environment, key to achieving
            the project's objectives. However, lessons also outline
            the need for strong Bank supervision, and pro-active
            monitoring of the implementation progress, to include as
            well a project design with a precise selection, and
            coordination of components. Under the circumstances,
            although the project did include legal, and regulatory
            reforms, these were not implemented due to the limited
            Government capacity. It is important to take into account
            that post-conflict countries' ability to sustain
            commitments, and ownership will hinder a reform agenda, and
            thus the full success of project objectives. Therefore,
            special attention should be paid to implementation
            arrangements, particularly upon project re-design, by
            providing support to the implementing agency, and ensuring
            proper financial management, procurement, and overall
            project management.
